meanings.definition: Giving off sparks or flashes of light.
meanings.sent1: The fireworks were scintillant in the night sky.
meanings.sent2: The scintillant stars illuminated the dark night.
meanings.sent3: The scintillant fireflies danced around like tiny lanterns.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were scintillant with excitement as she opened the gift.
meanings.sent5: The scintillant disco ball reflected light in all directions.

meanings.sent1: The scintillant diamond caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent2: The lake looked scintillant under the sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The scintillant necklace made her feel like a princess.
meanings.sent4: His smile was as scintillant as the morning dew.
meanings.sent5: The scintillant dewdrops on the grass glistened in the morning light.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that sparkles or shines brightly.
meanings.sent1: The little girl was a scintillant in the school play with her glittery costume.
meanings.sent2: The scintillant of the ocean under the moonlight was mesmerizing.
meanings.sent3: The scintillant of the disco ball made everyone want to dance.
meanings.sent4: The scintillant of the gemstone caught the jeweler's eye.
meanings.sent5: The scintillant of the chandelier added elegance to the room.
